page.title: 07CHURCHES
page.content: At{West Tilbury}stands the Norman-towered church of St. James.It is an attractive small church of{flint and has a fascinating graveyard bearing witness to the hard times of the last century. The tower is no longer safe and the small congregation has been absorbed by nearby St.Catherine in East Tilbury. St. Mary's stands at the top of the hill next to the crossroads in { {Chadwell}St.Mary.Similar in style to St. James it still has a thriving congregation. There is also a Pentecostal Church in Chadwell,and a cemetery chapel.There is a Methodist Chapel in Linford, and also the small, rather box-like modern Church called St.Francis.The Bata-estate part of East Tilbury has no church but people attend those in Linford or East Tilbury Village.
